Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, it was observed that 4 medication boxes with psychotropic medications was not double locked.
When reviewing the incident report, the address to the facility was not on the serious incident report.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA with the updated serious incident report which includes the operation's address.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing staff files, 2/2 files did not contain an affidavit.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA with the 2 affidavits for the staff files reviewed at the time of the inspection. The LCCA also reported that all files have been audited and include the affidavit.

Deficiency Narrative: When conducting a walkthrough, 3 psychotropics medications were observed not to be double locked.
When reviewing staff files, 2/2 contained incomplete records of training and did not include the hours of training.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA and reports a running list of hours for training has been included to the personnel checklist in all personnel files.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that a child walked out of the home without staff knowing, while 2 staff were upstairs and 1 was in the office.
Correction Narrative: An in-person inspection was conducted on 8/26/25 at the operation. Interviews were held with 2 staff, including the LCCA and staff present when the citation was issued. Service plan was reviewed. Interviews conducted assessed supervision when children in care want to go outside. There were no further concerns with supervision.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing staff files, 2/2 training certificate report they completed 16 hours of SAMA training in 1 day but completed only 8 contact hours.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA and reports that all SAMA certificates have been updated to 8 hours for the 1st session and will be completed in 2 8-hour sessions over two days.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed through photo documentation of a child actively using a broken futon.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. The operation reports that the futon has been disposed of and is no longer available for use.

Deficiency Narrative: Through interviews and documentation, it was determined that 2 children in care were not being supervised according to their preliminary service plan requiring 1:1 supervision.
Correction Narrative: Admin implemented that Treatment Director is the one who authorizes a 1:1 and signs off on preliminary service plans. Those and safety plans are now shared with staff through employee notification system.

Deficiency Narrative: Through interviews and documentation reviewed it was determined that a child in care did not have a preliminary service plan within the required 72 hours.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. Treatment Director will conduct frequent chart audits to ensure all documents are in residents file by deadline. TD will also review plans with staff and day shift will huddle for passdowns in admin office 10/15 min prior to shift change.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing medication logs for 1 child in care, there were 4 prescription medication doses missed.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. Admin implemented that staff must submit daily logs for verification check. They also report that the CMA/Med tech is checking MAR's daily.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing the medication log for a child in care, the child was not prescribed 1 medication as directed by their medication label and was given 2 doses instead of 3 on 4 different dates.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from the LCCA reporting that medication logs are now being reviewed daily by an additional set of eyeseither the LCCA, the Treatment Director or another designated staff memberto ensure there are no discrepancies in documentation or dosing. 
To further enhance accountability, we have implemented a protocol requiring staff to submit timestamped photos of each medication administration to our secured group thread immediately after the dose is given. This measure ensures real-time verification, transparency, and timely oversight.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was not able to provide a serious incident report after Law Enforcement came out to the operation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation with the updated SIR for the incident on 6/26/25. The LCCA also reports ensuring all serious incident reports are completed and sent to licensing upon request and in a timely manner.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incident report lacks any documentation indicating that a call or email was made to the CPS workerthere is no entry for the workers name, phone number, date, or time of contact.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator reporting they have created a new incident report that will be used for all incident going forward.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was found the operation did not schedule the follow up appointments with the child's PCP and gastroenterologist   with in 24 to 48 hours as directed by the discharged orders.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA reporting that the appointment was made but needed to be scheduled further out than 24-48 hours. The LCCA reports the operation will include all doctor contacts in the child's file and will be available for review.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, a request for training records for an employee was made on 7/14/2025 and was not received.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator and reports that all documents requested by licensing will be sent over in a timelier manner.

Deficiency Narrative: The incident provided did not document that child had mental health crisis, injured others, or was placed in a hold.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation reporting a new serious incident report has been created following a previous deficiency and will be implemented going forward. The LCCA reports they will also have a team meeting discussing serious incident reports.

Deficiency Narrative: It was reported that the child did not have a follow up appointment for his fractured foot.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator and reports that all follow-up appointments will be made as soon as possible and documented. The LCCA reports they will also have a team meeting discussing serious incidents, hotline calls, and medical documentation, including follow-up appointments.

Deficiency Narrative: The incident report provided by Hope Bridge Home did not show a contact being made to Licensing within 24 hours. The Hot-Line did not show a contact being made within 24 hours.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation and reports that the hotline will be called for serious incidents, including a broken toe, as soon as possible but no later than 24 ours after finding out. The LCCA reports a team meeting will be held to discuss serious incidents and hotline reports.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation there was no documentation of the circumstances around the use of emergency behavior intervention.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation reporting that a form for EBI has been created and reviewed during the team meeting held on 7/28/25 and will be implemented after the use of a restraint, in addition to the incident report.

Deficiency Narrative: In the serious incident report reviewed, information was missing regarding names of all adults involved and their relation to the children, the child's date of admission, and information for the treating healthcare professional. The report also did not document if the incident was reported to licensing or the child's legal parent.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation that they will be implementing the new serious incident form that includes all required components.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that a child did not have a suicide risk screening conducted after expressing suicidal ideations.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA reporting that the ASQ will be administered for any and all children expressing suicidal ideations, regardless of their age.

Deficiency Narrative: In the unauthorized absence log reviewed, there was no unauthorized absence documented for a child's runaway on 6/17. There was also no name documented for the staff responsible for another runaway.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA reporting all unauthorized absences will be logged appropriately. The LCCA reports the date was updated to the log after being sent to licensing and the log has been updated to include the staff and will be added when completing the log immediately. The log was received and reviewed and includes the corrections of including the unauthorized absence for the child in care and includes staff present at the time of the absence.

Deficiency Narrative: According to a medication log reviewed, a child did not receive prescribed topical cream three times daily according to doctor's orders.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA reporting that all prescription medications will be given as instructed by the label. The staff will draw lines where a medication begins/ends as needed.

Deficiency Narrative: In two children's service plans reviewed, there was another child's name documented in the plan.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the LCCA reporting documents will be reviewed by a second person and by themselves as LCCA.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, it was determined that Benjamin and Precious would supervise the children between the hours of 5pm to 10pm and had not completed all of their preservice training.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's LCCA and report that the two individuals involved in the citation are no longer living in the home and are no longer caring for the children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, the ratio of qualified caregivers was not kept. The children were supervised by unqualified caregivers.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation and report that the owners who were supervising the children are no longer in the home and no longer perform supervising or caregiver duties. The LCCA also reports multiple staff being hired as caregivers to prevent shortages.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was determined that a child was placed in a personal hold by a person that was not a caregiver. A caregiver is a person counted in the child/caregiver ratio, whose duties include the direct care, supervision, guidance, and protection of a child. This
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation and report that the owners who were supervising the children are no longer in the home and no longer perform supervising or caregiver duties. The LCCA also reports multiple staff being hired as caregivers to prevent shortages.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed the child's Service Plan was not signed until 71 days after admission.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. Service plans will be completed within 30 days of placement and sent to the legal party within 45 days.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was unable to provide an Annual Summary Log or Unauthorized Absence Log when requested.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. The administrator created and submitted an updated unauthorized absence log that will be used for the operation and includes all current unauthorized absences that have taken place.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was unable to provide an Incident Report for the victim's third elopement on 5-14-25.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. They report all serious incident reports will be completed for unauthorized absences in a timely manner.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed the Incident Reports provided did not document the duration of time the child was gone from the operation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. Serious incident reports will be completed for unauthorized absences in a timely manner.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed previous staff of the operation actively have Background Checks beyond 7 days of resignation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. The operation updated background checks. It was observed previous staff of the operation now have inactive background checks.

Deficiency Narrative: Due to the operation not documenting a third elopement from a child in care within 60 days, the operation did not conduct an Unauthorized Absence Triggered Review.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation. Triggered reviews will be completed once a child has had 3 or more absences within a 60-day period.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that one serious incident report did not include the names of any staff that was involved in the incident or identify any witnesses. The report also included conflicting information regarding time and date.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation administrator and report as the LCCA, a proper review of all serious incident reports will be completed before approving all incident reports. This includes ensuring names of all adults and children involved are listed.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was unable to provide an Incident Report for the victim's first ER visit on 5/19/25.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation administrator and report as the LCCA, a proper review of all serious incident reports will be completed before approving them. This includes ensuring reports are created for serious incidents for all medical purposes/ER visits.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that the victim's Preliminary Service Plan had time stamps showing the signature and medication list were added 27 days after admission.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation on 7/16/25 reporting they will continue implementing the updated preliminary service plan and ensure they are completed within 72 hours of placement.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection,  one serious incident report did not identify the witness' to the incident.  It did not include the name of the staff that was involved in the incident.  The names of who assisted the staff with the incident, or the name of the child who was a witness to the incident .
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator reporting they have created a new incident report that will be used for all incident going forward.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, one serious incident report did not contain the name, date and phone number of when the  parent (CPS worker) was contacted.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator reporting they have created a new incident report that will be used for all incident going forward.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was found one serious incident report was not called into licensing immediately as the child was a trafficking victim, or within 6 hours.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation and the LCCA report that all serious incident reports that warrant a hotline call will be called in within the allotted time frame per minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: An in-person inspection was conducted on 7/30/25. Three interviews were conducted with children in care and 2 with staff assessing supervision on electronic devices. The staff and the children interviewed all stated there are 2 to 4 staff during the day and 1 staff at night.  There are currently 4 children placed in the home. The owners have moved out of the home and are no longer supervising the kids when there is no staff.  The operation has gotten several new staff and their shifts are staggered.  The computer is used downstairs at the table and staff sits with them while they are using the computer.  There are no concerns with children in care using electronic devices and interviews report adequate supervision."
Correction Narrative: Follow up was completed on 7/30/25. Through interviews with children and staff assessments there appears to be adequate supervision and monitoring of devices.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing 2 staff files, there was no pre-employment screening conducted for the staff prior to them being hired.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation with the updated reference checks for the two files. A phone call was also held with the CEO and administrator reporting that all staff files have been updated with reference checks. The operation reports ensuring that all leadership will complete reference checks prior to hiring staff.

Deficiency Narrative: A review of the preliminary service plan for a child with specialized level of care needs did not meet the standard which required a description of the child's immediate treatment and care needs.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's LCCA. The operation reports updating the preliminary service plan to include all required components. All preliminary service pans for children in care will be reviewed and updated by the LCCA and included in the child's file.

Deficiency Narrative: I received a copy of the discharge summary which was incomplete as it was missing critical information.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the owner of the operation to include a new discharge summary form that will be implemented by the operation. The operation also sent over an updated discharge form for the child in care involved in the investigation. The operation also reported they will implement immediate training for all program and clinical staff on discharge documentation standards, implement mandatory use of the revised form, conduct monthly internal audits of discharge documentation, and introduce a discharge checklist to ensure no required elements are overlooked.
